Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • Job

  • public class Job
extends java.lang.Object
    Job.java Job implements a basic construct for jobs in the context of operating systems.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Job()
      Default constructor generates a new job (process), initializing every attribute of the job to -1.
      Job(int id, int memReq, int timeReq)
      Constructor generates a new job (process) based on three integer arguments.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decrementTimeRemaining()
      Decrements the time left that a job must execute before terminating.
      boolean getChanged()
      Returns whether or not this job has been changed in a time slice.
      int getJobID() 
      int getMemRequested() 
      int getSegID() 
      JobStatus getStatus() 
      int getTimeRemaining() 
      int getTimeRequested() 
      void reset()
      Resets the timeRemaining and status of the job to original timeRequested and NEW respectively.
      void setChanged(boolean b)
      Keep track of whether this job changed in a time slice.
      void setSegID(int id)
      Sets the segment id of the job to a specified integer.
      void setStatus(JobStatus s)
      Sets the status of the job to a specified enumerated value.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Overrides the default toString() method inherited from Object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Job

        public Job(int id,
   int memReq,
   int timeReq)
        Constructor generates a new job (process) based on three integer arguments.
        Parameters:
        id - the job id
        memReq - the memory space requested by the job
        timeReq - the CPU burst time requested by the job

      • Job

        public Job()
        Default constructor generates a new job (process), initializing every attribute of the job to -1.

    • Method Detail

      • getJobID

        public int getJobID()
        Returns:
        the integer representing the id of the job.

      • getMemRequested

        public int getMemRequested()
        Returns:
        the integer representing the memory requested by the job.

      • getSegID

        public int getSegID()
        Returns:
        the integer representing the memory segment id that the job currently occupies.

      • getTimeRequested

        public int getTimeRequested()
        Returns:
        the integer representing the CPU burst time (execution time) requested by the job.

      • getTimeRemaining

        public int getTimeRemaining()
        Returns:
        the integer representing the time remaining that the job must execute before terminating.

      • getStatus

        public JobStatus getStatus()
        Returns:
        the current status that the job is in.
        See Also:
        JobStatus

      • setSegID

        public void setSegID(int id)
        Sets the segment id of the job to a specified integer. Typically used when allocating jobs in memory.
        Parameters:
        id - the integer id of a memory segment

      • decrementTimeRemaining

        public void decrementTimeRemaining()
        Decrements the time left that a job must execute before terminating.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(JobStatus s)
        Sets the status of the job to a specified enumerated value.
        See Also:
        JobStatus

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the timeRemaining and status of the job to original timeRequested and NEW respectively.
        See Also:
        JobStatus

      • setChanged

        public void setChanged(boolean b)
        Keep track of whether this job changed in a time slice.
        Parameters:
        b - sets the flag for this job

      • getChanged

        public boolean getChanged()
        Returns whether or not this job has been changed in a time slice.
        Returns:
        the current value of changed

        Overrides the default toString() method inherited from Object.
